intro: Peixotoa hispidula f. subtomentosa, commonly known as the hairy peixotoa, is a rare and distinctive plant species belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from pale pink to white. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually opposite and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
